how am I install p7zip-full_4.43~dfsg.1-: do you really need 4.43 as opposed to 4.42? =)
read about APT a little. you don't manually download and then install - the apt-get command downloads *and* installs

*NO*, you need to type "sudo apt-get install p7zip-full" (after enabling universe), not the file name. you don't need to download *any* file manually, at least unless you've got a very compelling reason to use version 4.43 instead of 4.42

yes, because THAT IS NOT an Ubuntu package. use the official Ubuntu package. just type "sudo apt-get install p7zip-full" after enabling Universe
and this is the foruth time i tell you
yes, as you have to *enable universe* first
The packages in Ubuntu are divided into several sections. See http://www.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/components https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Repositories
there is also source-o-matic at http://www.ubuntu-nl.org/source-o-matic

the short answer is, you enable universe by adding "universe" after "main" and "restricted" in your /etc/apt/sources.list (on the "edgy", "edgy-updates" and "edgy-security" lines). but you better read the guide
